result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber R Hendryx

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for Amber R Hendryx.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that Defendant has begun treatment, and requests a date in 60 dates. Offer contemplates a municipal resolution upon successful completion of treatment. 

Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Matthew Huppertz
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day.

8:28 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Amber R Hendryx in court.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for Amber R Hendryx. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Huppertz appears on behalf of the Defendant

Adjustment Number: 22A 033901,
Payable Number: 473744,
Receipt Number: 22R 036794,
Amount: $20.00
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/23/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
